pr_title: MULE-18875: ValueProvider/SampleData optional parameters declared in resolver are not included in the model

timeline.bodyText: Maybe the parameter default value is useful data? Or do we want to leave it as null?
timeline.author: ndinu

replies.bodyText: What do you have in mind? Inherit the default value from the real parameter? or allow to define a new default value at the ValueProvider?
replies.author: gabrieldalborgo

replies.bodyText: I had in mind setting the default value of the real parameter, which is the value that will be taken for values resolution is none is provided.
replies.author: ndinu

timeline.bodyText: So, we say it is required when the @ Optional is not present in the VP, right?
timeline.author: ndinu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -247,11 +254,17 @@ private void enrichParameter(OfValues resolverClass,
         .orElse(empty());
   }
 
-  private List<String> getRequiredParametersAliases(List<ExtensionParameter> parameterDeclarations,
-                                                    Map<String, String> parameterNames) {
-    return parameterDeclarations.stream()
-        .filter(ExtensionParameter::isRequired)
-        .map(param -> parameterNames.getOrDefault(param.getName(), param.getName()))
+  private List<ParameterModel> getParametersModel(List<ExtensionParameter> parameterDeclarations,
+                                                  Map<String, String> parameterNames,
+                                                  List<ParameterDeclaration> allParameters) {
+    Map<String, Boolean> paramsInfo = parameterDeclarations.stream()
+        .collect(toMap(param -> parameterNames.getOrDefault(param.getName(), param.getName()), ExtensionParameter::isRequired));
+    return allParameters.stream()
+        .filter(param -> paramsInfo.containsKey(param.getName()))
+        .map(param -> new ImmutableParameterModel(param.getName(), param.getDescription(), param.getType(),
+                                                  param.hasDynamicType(), paramsInfo.get(param.getName()),

timeline.bodyText: I think we should add tests that assert the value provider model other than the check of the test extensions extension model.
timeline.author: ndinu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -155,9 +162,9 @@ private void enrichParameter(OfValues resolverClass,
     paramDeclaration.addModelProperty(propertyBuilder.build());
 
     valueProviderModelConsumer
-        .accept(new ValueProviderModel(getRequiredParametersAliases(resolverParameters, containerParameterNames),

replies.bodyText: Where would you create those tests?
replies.author: gabrieldalborgo

replies.bodyText: I would create a test for the enricher where the extension declaration is mocked, and then enriched, then assert the enriched declaration.
replies.author: ndinu

timeline.bodyText: you should use the aliased name here instead of param.getName().
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: same as before. You're loosing the aliased name. Several test cases should have broken because of this. If not, we have a coverage problem you should fix as part of this PR
timeline.author: marianogonzalez
